title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 220.1 - Description
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7 ยง 220.1 - Description

State Regulations

The Family Reunion Program (FRP) is designed to provide
approved incarcerated individuals and their families the opportunity to meet
for an extended period of time in privacy. The goal of the program is to
preserve, enhance and strengthen family ties that have been disrupted as a
result of incarceration. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 7
ยง
220.1

Amended

New

York State Register August 4, 2021/Volume XLIII, Issue 31, eff. 8/4/2021

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
